sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And as winter rages on and temperatures drop, dozens of countries have pledged 1 billion euros to Ukraine during a donors' conference in Paris, so it can keep its people fed, warmed, empowered.

sentences.sentence: Fighting in Ukraine has forced around 6.5 million people to flee their homes.

sentences.sentence: Just outside Kiev in Borodyanka, some residents are facing the freezing Ukrainian winter without

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We cover ourselves with few blankets. That's how we sleep.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Since the fighting began, most of Bakhmut's pre-war 70,000 population has fled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I was promised a new combustion furnace for heating, but I never got it.

sentences.sentence: President Zelensky explained the currently critical situation to a conference in Paris right now about 12 million people in almost all regions and the capital are disconnected from the supply unfortunately this is a typical situation for us and we expect new Russian strikes every day which can dramatically increase the number of shutdowns dozens of countries and international organizations pledged 1 billion euros in aid to keep Ukrainians powered fed warmed and moving as winter approaches flooded roads in Lisbon is just one of the scenes in Portugal where the country was slammed by heavy rains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Parisians have been told to not venture out on Wednesday as more snow is expected to disrupt the transport network.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Bosnia and Herzegovina is a major step closer to joining the European Union after the bloc's European Affairs Ministers agreed to recommend the country be granted candidate member status.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The decision, taken at a Brussels meeting on Tuesday, is expected to be endorsed by the leaders of member states at a summit on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's already been welcomed by the union's enlargement commissioner, Olivier Vahy, in a tweet he declared the EU path is open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Bosnia joins Serbia, Albania, North Macedonia and Montenegro among Balkan nations to have one official candidacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Kosovo is working towards the same goal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But it can take many years for full membership to be granted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: With its complex internal structures and multi-ethnic composition, Bosnia and Herzegovina has a lot of work to do to achieve the reforms required by Brussels to become a member of the club.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Nearly 13,000 Albanians have arrived in the UK so far this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While most of the images show people boarding buses, a third of all of those who make it to Britain come in small boats, making the dangerous, often lethal, journey across the English Channel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Many say they're fleeing corruption, low quality of life and even modern slavery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: of life and even modern slavery. But now the British Prime Minister is vowing to clear what he calls a backlog of asylum seekers, adding the vast majority of Albanian nationals arriving without visas will be removed immediately.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So today I can announce a new agreement with Albania and a new approach.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: First, we will embed border force officers in Tirana airport for the first time ever, helping to disrupt organized crime and stop people coming here illegally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Many of the Albanian asylum seekers are single adult men.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The numbers represent around 1% of the country's working age, according to figures from Eurostat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In recent months, rallies have exploded onto the streets of Albania's capital, Tirana, and other cities, protesting against the rising cost of living. But British ministers say Albania is a safe country, and Albanians are less likely to be granted asylum than other nationalities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: UK inflation declined at the sharpest rate in 16 months to 10.7% in November, down from a 41-year high of 11.1% in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Despite the easing, British officials said it was too soon to say whether if the inflation had peaked, as the country is struggling with supermarket prices rising and high energy costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Wednesday's news follows an international trend, as the US announced on Tuesday a second consecutive drop in inflation rates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Europe's November rate is expected to drop to 10% from 10.6%, according to Eurostat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: that will give federal protection to same-sex and interracial marriages in his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The legislation comes after concerns were raised that the Supreme Court could attempt to re-evaluate the cases that had previously legalized unions, regardless of sex or race.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This law and the law of its defense strike a blow against hate in all its forms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And that's why this law matters to every single American, no matter who you are or who you love.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: 68% of Americans now support same-sex marriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: marriage. Lionel Messi is just one game away from having his hands on the World Cup.

sentences.sentence: A comfortable 3-0 win over Croatia saw Argentina fans erupt outside the Lucille Stadium in Doha.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A penalty kick from Messi kick-started the party, followed by two from Julian Alvarez.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, for the tens of thousands of Argentina fans here in Qatar they got the result they wanted Leonel's Colonies men have booked a spot in a World Cup final for the second time in eight years and with Argentina fans well acquainted by now with the iconic Lucille Stadium they'll be flocking to the 88,000 capacity venue cheering on Messi and company on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The scenes back home in Buenos Aires were just as ecstatic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Fan zones have been dotted all around Argentina's capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And for Argentinians, the pride and joy is uncontrollable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They have achieved what we all wanted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There is still a long way to go, but this Sunday I want to cry with joy.

sentences.sentence: We have faith in Messi and the other players. Game after game they show us that we are the best in the world. Whether it's France or Morocco it doesn't matter which one, we welcome them with great happiness." The Albi Celeste have won their last four World Cup semi-finals, but they have lost their two last finals in 1990 and 2014 against Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now, as you see, a whole nation counts on Lionel Messi to lift the most sought-after football trophy in the world, 36 years after Diego Maradona.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Cyril Fourenice for Euronews in Buenos Aires.
